nodes.name: Fast Pillars Setup Room Junction (Bottom Center)

strats.name: Hjless
note: Destroying the obstacle isn't seen to take extra time for two reasons.
1- It destroys the shot blocks as well which are assumed to be manually destroyed each time since they respawn.
2- This assumes no jump assists, and some of the time loss of waiting for the PB is offset by having to setup for a pretty tight wall jump setup anyway.
strats.devNote: It might bo slightly faster to do a stationary spinjump rather than the setup, but we won't go into that much detail.

strats.name: BlueSpace

Avoiding acid damage at the last jump is tricky but possible.

strats.name: HeatProof Pirates Kill
strats.note: Being heatproof allows slower kill methods.
strats.devNote: Morph bombs are still excluded because they take 30 bombs each and that's ridiculous.

strats.name: Power Bomb Pirates Kill + Bomb Blocks
note: It's not really possible to hit all enemies with double-PB hits while not taking damage.
Using Power Bomb Periphery is based on a strat that allows killing them and taking out the blocks with 4 PBs.
This calculation ends up taking 5, leaving a spare PB.

strats.name: Base
note: It's not possible to reach node 3 without destroying obstacle B.

obstacles.note: Morph Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

note: This expects that the PB gets used a bit before the node is actually reached.
This is why the full wait time isn't included in heat frames.

strats.name: Avoid Hibashi
devNote: The hibashi hit can be avoided by waiting for the pillar to go up.
That requires the use of one PB and more time than is worth unless heat proof.

obstacles.note: Morph Bombs are not excluded here because there are consistent, safe setups for all Dessgeegas from this direction.

Mickey Mouse Left Door (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

runways.name: Base Runway - Mickey Mouse Left Door (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This runway requires killing the Dessgeegas closest to the door, and taking a Multiviola hit if the Multiviola is alive.
strats.devNote: This strat doesn't actually clear obstacle E, but since we're leaving the room after it doesn't really matter.

locks.name: Mickey Mouse Grey Lock (to Fast Pillars Setup Room)

unlockStrats.name: Kill 5 Multiviolas
note: The Multiviolas are far away and can't be killed from here, hence the local requirement of 'never'.
The only path through this room where killing them and leaving here would be meaningful would have passed through node 4 at some point.
So this strat is only doable by killing the Multiviolas when going 4 -> 6.

unlockStrats.name: Kill Bottom Left
unlockStrats.note: The obstacles have requirements of 'never' on the assumption that Samus travels to 7 or 6 and back to unlock the door.

devNote: In reality, any combination of 5 enemies will unlock the door.
But this room is way too complicated to try and track all possibilities.
We went with the two most plausible ones.

obstacles.name: Some Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: Represents one set of bomb blocks from obstacle A, with the rest intact. So this obstacle is mutually exclusive with obstacle A.

obstacles.name: Runway Dessgeegas
obstacles.note: The 3 Dessgeegas closest to the left door

obstacles.name: Boxed-in Multiviolas
obstacles.note: The 5 Multiviolas in the Multiviola boxes

obstacles.name: Bottom Multiviolas
obstacles.note: The 2 Multiviolas in the bottom hallway

obstacles.name: Far Dessgeegas
obstacles.note: The 2 Dessgeegas farthest from the left door in the bottom hallway

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: More heat frames than shinespark frames because the shinespark bonk takes some time.

to.note: Direct link for SpeedBooster strats. Other strats should go 1-> 7-> 6.

strats.name: HiJump
strats.note: Requires one jump off a crumble block

strats.name: HiJump Springball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to just bounce on the crumble blocks.

strats.name: MidAir Spring Ball
strats.note: Requires one jump off a crumble block

strats.name: MickeyMouse Crumbleless MidAir Spring Ball
note: Doable by pausing early enough and starting laterla momentum before the pause.
The timing of the jump itself becomes very precise.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Crumble Speedjump
note: Spinjump off a crumble block with just a tiny amount of run speed.
It has to be more speed than zero but less than what hits the first big height drop in the formula.
That gives just enough height to be able to walljump out.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse IBJ
note: This one's pretty horrible.
The shot block respawns quickly so it's pretty unforgiving on the IBJ executions.
On top of that, the IBJ is off a mid-air morph off a crumble block.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse SpringBall IBJ
strats.note: Shoot the block before starting or in mid-air, then use spring ball to bounce on the crumb blocks and start an IBJ.

strats.name: Power Bombs
strats.note: This is done by positioning the Power Bomb far enough left to only partially clear the blocks.
strats.devNote: Not sure if there's a way to get here and have the strat be relevant though?

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.note: Considered killable with Power Beam without taking damage.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Multiviolas. This is one-way because the way back requires setting up the ice clip.

strats.name: Iframe Blue Suit Run
strats.note: Taking damage off a Dessgeega at the far right, coming in from the top, allows you to charge a blue suit and get through to the door. It doesn't fully clear any one obstacle though.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Crystal Flash Grapple Clip
note: It is considered free to kill the Multiviolas with Power Beam while heatproof, and heatproof is required for the CF clip.
All of the bomb blocks will be destroyed while performing the Crystal Flash.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.devNote: Morph Bombs excluded because there's no safe setup.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Dessgeegas

strats.name: Setup Ice Clip

note: Ice is required because it's needed for the clip anyway.
It's relevant here because it two-shots Multiviolas.
The one hit is here as a safety, and is likely required if the Dessgeegas below aren't there yet.

strats.note: This is not just getting up there, but also bringing the correct Multiviola with you.

strats.name: Speed Through
note: If the Dessgeegas to the far right are killed, a short charge can get through.
To avoid redundancy, they must be killed by travelling between 7 and 6.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill

obstacles.note: Pretty much any weapon but PowerBeam and Morph Bombs can kill the Multiviolas in time to not take a hit.

note: Some weapons are very slow and require use of the safe spot above node 6.
This is why the Dessgeegas to the right must already be dead.
strats.devNote: Morph Bombs are excluded because there is no safe setup.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Dessgeegas and Multiviolas
Options are to tank the damage or kill the Dessgeegas
to.devNote: No heatproof strats because it's less damage to run to the safe spot above 6 and kill them from there

strats.name: Plasma Wave Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Plasma Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Missiles Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Supers Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Screw Kill Sparing Multiviolas
strats.note: You can't catch the Multiviolas to kill them with Screw without reaching node 6.

to.note: Options are to Speed Booster dash or spark through, tank the damage, kill the Dessgeegas and Multiviolas, or go slower to spare the Multiviolas
to.devNote: No heatproof strats because it's less damage to run to the safe spot above 6 and lure everything there

strats.note: Use a Morph Bomb to get up and over the Fune.

strats.name: Fireflea Room Fune Boost
note: A well-done mid-air morph can get up and over the Fune using the boost from a projectile hit.
This leads to a softlock if it's the only way in, because it doesn't work on the way out.

strats.name: Norfair Fireflea Bug Boost Escape
note: It's precise, and could only be needed if you don't feel like doing a walljump.
But you can dboost off the highest Fireflea if you can set up to get hit at the apex of your jump.
